content:
I’m working on getting this hugo blog up and running. I want to have a place where I can share my thoughts on projects I’ve been working on. I’ve been keeping a google doc journal for myself but I feel like it’s a hassle to have to go online to write it. I was thinking about moving my journal to markdown anyways so I might as well just host it online with hugo as well. I’ll try this for a bit and also keep my google doc journal and see which one I like better.
I think the problem with writing this straight in a markdown file is that there isn’t a spellchecker. My spelling have been getting progressively worse since I’ve stopped writing book reports with pen and paper.
Spell Checker in VSCode editor Actually I just found a the solution to the problem above. For context, I’m writing this in vscode on my computer and I found that there is a spellchecker extension called “Code Spell Checker” by Street Side Software after a quick search. It works great now! I think it only checks for spelling and not grammar… but google docs and microsoft word doesn’t do a spectacular job at that anyways.
Formatting text and emojis in VSCode with keyboard shortcuts Also apparently you can press » ctrl + p and type » >join lines to format the text (probably can also add this as a keyboard shortcut. I think I’ll use leave it for now). I found that you have to disable the “Prettier” extension with Hugo otherwise it will mess up the formatting of the code parts if you go and edit the themes. There’s probably a setting I can change to have it be compatible. I’ll look into that later. Also, you can press » ctrl + i to get emojis: üòÅ. Theres also Shortcodes for that… I think… but I don’t know how to do that yet so this is a nice alternative. I got my info from this stackoverflow page .
Open external links in new tab (target=”_blank”) with markdown in Hugo Add the following code to /layout/_default/_markup/render-link.html
<a href="{{ .Destination | safeURL }}"{{ with .Title}} title="{{ . }}"{{ end }}{{ if strings.HasPrefix .Destination "http" }} target="_blank"{{ end }}>{{ .Text }}</a>
